definition: to take leave
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: But for you, every day I will dream the most beautiful apart.
sentences.chinese: 可是由于有了你，我，天天均可以梦想最绚丽的拜别。

sentences.english: Alucard: Farewell then. We'll not meet again.
But why destroy the worshipers of other gods?
sentences.chinese: 但为何要灭绝敬拜别神的人呢？

sentences.english: There is only the swing creaking, that you have just left.
sentences.chinese: 你方才拜别，只有秋千吱嘎作响。

sentences.english: You can shed tears that he is gone .
sentences.chinese: 你可以堕泪，由于他曾经拜别。

definition: to take leave
to say goodbye/leave-taking/farewells
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to bow in salute/to kowtow
to bow again/to bow twice (gesture of respect in former times)/(in letters, an expression of respect)
to pay a return visit
to return/to go back/to come back
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to set out/to leave
to salute/to greet
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to salute/to make one's salutations
on leaving/on the point of departure
